title: Looking to Buy a T206 Red Cobb, PSA or SGC
author: secondhandwatches

posts.post_title: Looking to Buy a T206 Red Cobb, PSA or SGC
posts.post_content:
Hey everyone!  I am looking for nice eye appeal red t206 Cobb.  At least a 2 and up.  Feel free to reach out if you have anything and thank you!

Larry

I was going to offer this then I saw you don't want anything below a 2.... 
Maybe you should change it to lower grade but nice eye appeal....Good luck in your quest. A red cobby is a sort of a staple of vintage...

[IMG]https://luckeycards.com/t206cobb.jpg[/IMG]
Hi Leon...I sent you a PM

[quote name="secondhandwatches" post=2194901]Hi Leon...I sent you a PM[/QUOTE]

will respond but it's not really for sale unless someone gave me a number I can't refuse. And they won't. I probably shouldn't have responded at all but was just pointing out grades are subjective. This isn't really the place for that so my apologies.  And I hope the OP finds one that fits the bill. Got mine right before the prices skyrocketed. 
.

[quote name="Leon" post=2194889]I was going to offer this then I saw you don't want anything below a 2.... 
Maybe you should change it to lower grade but nice eye appeal....Good luck in your quest. A red cobby is a sort of a staple of vintage...

[IMG]https://luckeycards.com/t206cobb.jpg[/IMG][/QUOTE]


That is a beauty Leon! Congrats! 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Not to further hijack, but can someone explain to me why that is a 1.5?  If it were trimmed would be an "A" so what's with this?

[quote name="joshleon" post=2195152]Not to further hijack, but can someone explain to me why that is a 1.5?  If it were trimmed would be an "A" so what's with this?[/QUOTE]

Pretty sure there’s a pinhole
Look to the left of “Cobb” - that seeming imperfection is on both sides of the card
That’s my guess
